body.p: Although all forms of DITA content reuse leverage the same underlying mechanics, each form presents distinct challenges.

dd.p: DITA offers several robust technologies designed to support content reuse.

ul.li: Maps: reusing one map in multiple other maps with content filters
Maps: reusing one topic in multiple contexts with multiple content filters
Topicsets: reusing named collections of map references to topics
Content libraries: reusing named blocks of content from topics
Direct content referencing (conrefs): URI-based reuse of referenced content (library elements, topics, or maps)
Indirect content referencing (keyrefs): Key-based reuse of referenced content (library elements, topics, or maps)

dd.p: That said, the flexibility and power of these mechanics tend to obscure how they are used in order to support the different forms of reuse.
Strategies for reusing content developed and maintaned by human beings (authors), e.g. shared topics, shared content libraries, or keyword libraries.
Strategies for reusing content extracted from engineering sources by computer applications, e.g. API libraries, message libraries, GUI resource text and graphics.
Strategies for exporting, importing, or reusing content between organizations deploying different information architectures and tools.
